segments.source_content: [NLUX](https://docs.nlkit.com/nlux?utm_source=twir-jl24) is a powerful open-source React library that makes it super easy to **add conversational AI capabilities to your web apps**. Create high-quality chat UIs with just a few lines of code.

CrÃ©ez des interfaces de chat de haute qualitÃ© avec seulement quelques lignes de code.

CrÃ©ez des interfaces de chat haute qualitÃ© avec seulement quelques lignes de code.

segments.source_content: Check the project's [GitHub repository](https://github.com/nlkitai/nlux) to get started, or visit the [docs website](https://docs.nlkit.com/nlux?utm_source=twir-jl24) for tutorials, examples, and API reference.

segments.source_content: We havenâ€™t had any huge React announcement this week, so I thought it would be cool to remind you about all the great upcoming React 19 features thanks to this [great bento slide from Lydia Hallieâ€™s talk](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AJOGzVygGcY). Note that [React 19 is in Release Candidate](https://react.dev/blog/2024/04/25/react-19) and should be out soon.

translations.fr: Nous n'avons pas eu d'annonce majeure sur React cette semaine, alors j'ai pensÃ© qu'il serait intÃ©ressant de vous rappeler les futures fonctionnalitÃ©s de React 19 grÃ¢ce Ã  cette [excellente slide Bento de la confÃ©rence de Lydia Hallie](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AJOGzVygGcY). Notez que [React 19 est en Release Candidate](https://react.dev/blog/2024/04/25/react-19) et devrait sortir prochainement.
translations.en: Nous n'avons pas eu d'annonce majeure de React cette semaine, alors j'ai pensÃ© qu'il serait intÃ©ressant de vous rappeler toutes les excellentes fonctionnalitÃ©s Ã  venir de React 19 grÃ¢ce Ã  cette [superbe diapositive bento de la confÃ©rence de Lydia Hallie](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AJOGzVygGcY). Notez que [React 19 est en Release Candidate](https://react.dev/blog/2024/04/25/react-19) et devrait sortir prochainement.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Reactile â€“ a new approach to React-based web apps. Create your own views. Let it handle your windows and widgets in a single browser tab](https://www.reactile.net/?utm_source=reactnewsletter)
- ğŸ‘€ [Rsnext](https://github.com/ScriptedAlchemy/rsnext/commits/rspack): The Rspack team is working on getting Next.js to work under their Rust bundler and shared great progress. The first alphas have been published and can be tried by [aliasing â€œnextâ€ to â€œrsnextâ€](https://github.com/substancelabs/rsnext/blob/main/package.json#L11). Also, [Rspack 1.0 beta 1 is out with a new â€œlayersâ€ feature](https://x.com/rspack_dev/status/1818490358319530221), useful for bundling your app in multiple variants and supporting React Server Components. We'll share more about this in the future, once it's ready for prime time.
- ğŸ‘€ [Enhancing SEO in Flutter Web Projects with Next.js Integration](https://gist.github.com/lcw99/ac1738cb6d5bb032085077605f56665e): Flutter users are desperate to solve the web SEO problem, after Google shared its intention to [deprecate and remove the HTML renderer](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/145954). This awkward workaround is based on Next.js.
- ğŸ¦ [Million Lint - Get parents/children on hover, Locate render triggers](https://x.com/aidenybai/status/1816136004388176010)
- ğŸ“Š [Stack Overflow Dev Survey - The 2024 results](https://survey.stackoverflow.co/2024/): React, Node.js, and JavaScript remain the most popular technologies.
- ğŸ—“ï¸ [React Rally](https://reactrally.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Utah - 12-13, August - Last call ! You still have a chance to get your ticket, and donâ€™t forget the [10% discount](https://ti.to/react-rally/react-rally-2024/discount/TWIR) with code "TWIR".
- ğŸ—“ï¸ [Squiggle Conf](https://2024.squiggleconf.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Boston - 03 & 04 October - Get a 10% discount with code "TWIR". 1 day of conferences, 1 day of workshops, in the heart of Boston historic district, on web dev tooling !
- ğŸ“œ [React Owner Components](https://reacttraining.com/blog/react-owner-components): Greatly explains the difference between Owner and Parent components. The owner creates the JSX and passes props to it. Client Components cannot own Server Components.
- ğŸ“œ [Dissecting Partial Pre Rendering](https://www.nikhilsnayak.dev/blogs/dissecting-partial-pre-rendering): Illustrates how Next.js experimental PPR features takes the best of other rendering strategies with a concrete example: a static course page with dynamic reviews.
- ğŸ“œ [Vercel - Flags as Code in Next.js](https://vercel.com/blog/flags-as-code-in-next-js): Explains how the new package `@vercel/flags/next` encodes best practices for integrating feature flags in Next.js, decoupling your code from the underlying flag provider source. Flags are always evaluated server-side, this prevents layout shifts, spinners and disclosing sensitive things to the client. I find it pretty cool that it works with static pages and PPR too: you can precompute as many static variants as there are flag permutations!
- ğŸ“œ [Netlify - Live Preview for Gatsby is back (and better) with the new Dev Server](https://www.netlify.com/blog/gatsby-live-preview-with-new-dev-server/): Netlify has a new generic platform primitive to start your framework Dev Server in the cloud. Useful for Gatsby live previews when using compatible content (CMS) source plugins.
- ğŸ“œ [Flexible network data preloading in large SPAs](https://mmazzarolo.com/blog/2024-07-29-data-preloading-script/): When not using a framework, you might want to inline in the HTML some data preloading logic, to speed up your app startup time by parallelizing data/bundle fetching.
- ğŸ“œ [Creating your own store](https://www.smallrecipesfordisaster.com/posts/local-store): Shows what it takes to create your own store that you connect to React with `useSyncExternalStore`.
- ğŸ“œ [Exploring a useState-like API with Zustand: A Fun Experiment](https://www.smallrecipesfordisaster.com/posts/dispatch-zustand): Shows how you can build on top of Zustand so that selectors return a `[state, setState]` tuple.
- ğŸ“œ [After a Decade of React, Is Frontend a Post-React World Now?](https://thenewstack.io/after-a-decade-of-react-is-frontend-a-post-react-world-now/): There are good alternatives, but React is still growing, and I believe its growth is still accelerating (ğŸ¦ [tweet](https://x.com/sebastienlorber/status/1818233736091271285)).
- ğŸ“œ [Battle of the Asyncs](https://www.brenelz.com/posts/battle-of-the-asyncs/): Compares Reactâ€™s `use` hook with Solidâ€™s `createAsync`, and observes the React solution looks slightly less convenient (even with RSCs).
- ğŸ“œ [Why is Zustand a community favorite?](https://www.frontendundefined.com/posts/monthly/zustand-review/): Positive feedback for Zustand, a well-designed, lightweight state manager with selector support.
- ğŸ“œ [Boosting performance: Faireâ€™s transition to NextJS](https://craft.faire.com/boosting-performance-faires-transition-to-nextjs-3967f092caaf): Incremental migration from a Kotlin + React SPA to Next.js stack.
- ğŸ“œ [Complete Guide to State Management in React](https://www.propelauth.com/post/state-management-in-react): A comprehensive guide, also covering localStorage and query parameters.
- ğŸ“¦ [Preact 10.23 - Support ref cleanup functions](https://github.com/preactjs/preact/releases/tag/10.23.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Fumadocs 13.0 - Better Code Blocks, Callouts,](https://fumadocs.vercel.app/blog/v13)
- ğŸ“¦ [Bun 1.1.21 - Fix Remix Request/Response override issue](https://bun.sh/blog/bun-v1.1.21)
- ğŸ“¦ [Novel 0.5 - Notion-style AI-powered WYSIWYG editor](https://github.com/steven-tey/novel)
- ğŸ¥ [Jack Herrington - Vites Fatal Flaw Fixed With Vinxi](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C54k7nP4OjI)
- ğŸ¥ [Theo - New York Times Sees 30% Perf Win By Switching To React...18?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_6kDnkeReKo)
- ğŸ¥ [Web Dev Simplified - Learn React Generic Components In 6 Minutes](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5s6dIkrv6Y4)

segments.source_content: We had a lot of news about the New Architecture over the past months, including how it became the new default this year. Now, the teams at React Native and Expo have launched a survey to learn more about your adoption (or whatâ€™s keeping you from adopting it). It has 17 questions and should only take a couple of minutes, so I suggest we all help our friends at Meta and Expo out and share our New Arch experience with them. Iâ€™m sure theyâ€™ll pay us back by using the feedback for even more improvements!

translations.fr: Nous avons eu beaucoup de nouvelles concernant la Nouvelle Architecture ces derniers mois, y compris sur son passage par dÃ©faut cette annÃ©e. Maintenant, les Ã©quipes de React Native et Expo ont lancÃ© un sondage pour en savoir plus sur votre adoption (ou ce qui vous retient de l'adopter). Il comporte 17 questions et ne devrait prendre que quelques minutes, donc je suggÃ¨re que nous aidions tous nos amis de Meta et Expo et partagions notre expÃ©rience de la Nouvelle Architecture avec eux. Je suis sÃ»r qu'ils nous le rendront en utilisant les retours pour encore plus d'amÃ©liorations !
translations.en: Nous avons eu beaucoup de nouvelles concernant la Nouvelle Architecture ces derniers mois, y compris son adoption comme configuration par dÃ©faut cette annÃ©e. Les Ã©quipes React Native et Expo ont maintenant lancÃ© une enquÃªte pour mieux comprendre votre adoption (ou les obstacles Ã  celle-ci). Elle comporte 17 questions et ne prend que quelques minutes. Je suggÃ¨re donc que nous aidions tous nos amis chez Meta et Expo en partageant notre expÃ©rience de la Nouvelle Architecture. Je suis sÃ»r qu'ils nous rendront la pareille en utilisant ces retours pour encore plus d'amÃ©liorations !

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ‘€ [Node.js - Roadmap for experimental TypeScript support](https://github.com/nodejs/loaders/issues/217): Huge, Node.js just [merged the first PR](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/53725) of this plan, adding a new `--experimental-strip-types` option to let TypeScript run natively on Node.js.
- ğŸ‘€ [Agenda for the 103rd meeting of Ecma TC39](https://github.com/tc39/agendas/blob/main/2024/07.md): Happening right now! Great proposals have already progressed, such as `RegExp.escape`.
- ğŸ“œ [Patterns for Memory Efficient DOM Manipulation with Modern Vanilla JavaScript](https://frontendmasters.com/blog/patterns-for-memory-efficient-dom-manipulation/)
- ğŸ“œ [Garbage collection and closures](https://jakearchibald.com/2024/garbage-collection-and-closures/)
- ğŸ“œ [Please Stop Using Barrel Files](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/please-stop-using-barrel-files)
- ğŸ“œ [Providing Type Definitions for CSS with @property](https://moderncss.dev/providing-type-definitions-for-css-with-at-property/)
- ğŸ“œ [Deno - What we got wrong about HTTP imports](https://deno.com/blog/http-imports)
- ğŸ“¦ [TypeScript 5.6 Beta - Detect suspicious Truthish/Nullish checks, iterator methodsâ€¦](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-5-6-beta/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Node 20.16 - Add process.getBuiltinModule(id)](https://nodejs.org/en/blog/release/v20.16.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Babel 7.25 - Safari bugfixes and duplicated named capturing groups](https://babeljs.io/blog/2024/07/26/7.25.0)
